intro: Spermacoce thalictroides, commonly known as the African catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its fruits are small, dry capsules that release tiny seeds upon maturity. Spermacoce thalictroides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability.
